page.title: 04SHOTTENDEN
page.content: Shottenden is a small hamlet situated on the Downs some three miles north west of Chilham. It is only approached along narrow country lanes. When the snow comes in the winter the lanes are quickly filled and the snow plough is needed to keep the roads open. Sometimes the school coach cannot get through.In the main part of the village there are several houses. There is a post office which sells sweets, tinned and frozen food as well as stamps, and a post box and a telephone box. There is a pub in the village called the Plough and this is down by the main crossroads. There are one or two small groups of council houses but there are several farms and cottages.Much of the land surrounding the village is farmland. The farms keep livestock and grow crops and fruit.
